names.japanese: パッフィング・トムの屋根

description: The rooftop of the Puffing Tom sea train, where Franky battles Nero during the journey to Enies Lobby.

keyEvents.description: Franky debuts multiple techniques including Hoshi Shield and Master Nail during rooftop battle
Nero discovers Franky's vulnerable back weakness on the rooftop
Franky transforms into Centaur form (Franky Kentauros) for the first time on the roof

significance: Location of the intense battle between Franky and Nero, showcasing Franky's combat abilities and vulnerabilities.

names.japanese: パッフィング・トム1号車

description: The first car of the Puffing Tom sea train where Robin is being held captive by CP9.

keyEvents.description: Sogeking secretly communicates with Robin, revealing the crew's knowledge of her sacrifice
Sogeking informs Robin that Iceburg is alive

significance: Critical location where Robin learns that her sacrifice may be unnecessary and that her crew is coming to rescue her.

names.japanese: パッフィング・トム4号車

description: The fourth car of the Puffing Tom sea train where Sanji battles Wanze.

keyEvents.description: Sanji and Wanze continue their battle, with Wanze using Menkui Knocker attack
Sanji uses kitchen knives to counter Wanze's ramen-based attacks

significance: Battle location showcasing Sanji's adaptability and his principles about cooking tools.

description: A sea train commandeered by the Straw Hats, Franky Family, and Galley-La Company to pursue the Puffing Tom and rescue Robin.

keyEvents.description: The Rocketman encounters abandoned train cars left behind by the Puffing Tom
Zoro slices through the train cars to clear the Rocketman's path
Zoro senses T-Bone's presence from the Rocketman

significance: The rescue team's vehicle, carrying Luffy, Zoro, Nami, Chopper, and their allies as they pursue Robin.

description: The railroad tracks laid across the ocean connecting Water 7 to Enies Lobby, used by sea trains.

keyEvents.description: Abandoned train cars are encountered on the tracks
Defeated Sea Kings are found on the tracks, evidence of T-Bone's power

significance: The chase route where both the Puffing Tom and Rocketman travel toward Enies Lobby.
